Dear Jennifer Vasilovski:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 4/12/2023. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
Heather Reilly, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
CPA Rule 400.12326 Borrowed home
(2) The borrowing agency is responsible for securing
the items identified in subrules (1) (d), (e), (g), (h), and
(i) of this rule annually for the duration of the child’s
placement.
One of three borrowed bed files did not have a Foster Parent Agency Agreement
updated for 2022.
CPA Rule 400.12605 Adoptive family evaluation
(1) An agency social service worker shall complete a
written adoptive evaluation within 90 days of the family
signing an adoption application and prior to approving a
family for adoption.
One of three adoptive family evaluations was not completed within the required
timeframe.
FOM 722-06B Family Team Meeting
(Page 5) FTMs must occur within the required time
frames as outlined in the following tables: Updated
Case Plan (USP) - within 30 calendar days before the
case plan due date.

(page 13) The DHS-1105, Family Team Meeting
Report, must be completed for every FTM.
(Page 5) One of twenty USPs did not have an FTM completed within 30 days
prior.
(Page 13) One of eight case files held an FTM that did not have an 1105
completed as required.

FOM 801-03 Medical Passports
All medical information within the medical passport
must be current and updated at least quarterly to reflect
the child's current and complete health information.
Receipt of the medical passport by the above listed
parties is documented in MiSACWIS by uploading the
signed and dated signature page into the Health Profile
section.
One of eight foster care files was missing one, quarterly updated, medical
passport.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
6/6/22 INTERIM, CAP approved 6/15/22
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Medical Passports must be updated quarterly, even if they are not required to
be provided to case members quarterly. It was recommended the worker date
the quarterly updated passport, as a date is not auto generated by the
system.
• Renewal/annual evaluations for foster homes must contain specific dates that
Emergency Procedures were practiced.
• Family adoption assessments must be completed within 90 days per rules.
However, if the agency has insufficient information to make a
recommendation, the report can be completed without a recommendation. An
addendum would then need to be completed once information is obtained and
a recommendation made.

V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was not requested.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted two acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during
this licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
The agency had one CAP (approved 6/15/2022) as a result of the 6/6/2022 interim
review. During that review 10 violations were found. The agency reported
successful implementation of their CAP. However, noted having difficulty with
timeliness of adoption assessments, medical passports, and treatment plan
signatures. This information is consistent with what was found in the current
review. However, it was noted there has been improvement in these areas, and
overall less violations than the prior year.
The agency had one CAP (approved 6/29/22) as a result of the 6/7/22 special
evaluation in which it was alleged the agency did not include parents in
medical/dental treatment and decision making for their children in care. A violation
of FOM 801 Health Services For Children In Foster Care, was found. As of this
review, there have been no additional concerns. No additional violations of this
policy were found during this renewal review. Therefore, it is determined the
agency is in compliance at this time.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment (CAA) was reviewed and discussed on-site.
The CAA reported successful implementation of the CAP with ongoing efforts to
improve several identified areas. The agency reported continued difficulty in
completing and uploading timely 1105 reports for Family Team Meetings and
obtaining Treatment Plan signatures. The CAA also identified a trend of ongoing
problems with placement disruption and locating new placements for teens. This is
a known, statewide issue.
Financial Overview
No financial concerns were noted.
Staff and Youth Interviews

Three staff were interviewed on-site. Staff reported feeling appreciated and
supported by their agency. Overall, staff stated that the administrator and
supervisors are organized, knowledgeable, and help keep things running
smoothly. There were no suggestions by staff about improvements needed at the
agency.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency is located in an office building in a heavily populated area. The office
has locking storage for files and adequate space for staff. The agency also has
sufficient space for clients to meet with staff or have family visits.
VII. ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no identified safety concerns.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
